body:
TCK (limited tests, only the ajax parts) Pass
personal integrationt tests pass
Unit Tests pass!
@melloware looks like the JIRA you reference is off by one :) It should be MYFACES-4595, can you update it? Currently, it is linking to: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MYFACES-4594
Sorry yep let me fix
I fixed the title but I wonder if I have to fix the commit message for it to take effect?

> I fixed the title but I wonder if I have to fix the commit message for it to take effect?

Not sure, but would be good to clean up the commit message anyhow.
OK commit message fixed and ticket is now linked properly

looks good for me, just one task fails
can you check and merge?

Build failed due to :


I see the same npe in the 2.3.x branch ???

I see my error. I left out `facesContextPurgeMethod = getPurgeMethod(facesContext, "purgeFacesContext", NO_PARAMETER_TYPES);` 

Builds passes now. If no objections, I will merge later today

IMO we should completely refactor this 
there is no need to use reflection
we just need unwrap until we have e.g. a FacesContextImplBase and call #purgeFacesContext

Tests pass, additional unit test for the tobago usecase has been added!
The css eval code also has become simpler!
@volosied please check my commit, i fixed it in a different way

since this is reverted, should I redo the release?On Apr 7, 2023, at 1:44 PM, Melloware ***@***.***> wrote:﻿
Merged #564 into 2.3-next.

—Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.Message ID: ***@***.***>
Sorry @volosied yes please.
No problem. I'll try to get it done by tomorrow.

Even other excludes will propably break EL

Try to produce a ArrayList in requestscope and access via EL
@tandraschko you are right.  I guess there is nothing that can be done to reduce this noise on native image build.
failures are unrelatde to this change its more Drone -> Chrome issues.

After this merge, the myfaces codebase and the github codebase of the ajax scripts are back in sync!
I just wanted to give the tobago guys a little bit of time to test it, just in case something comes up before merging it in again!

Guys the integration test chrome driver needs an update again this is why the integration tests fail:

Error:    IntegrationTest.testPlainHtml » Runtime Unable to instantiate Drone via org.openqa.selenium.chrome.ChromeDriver(ChromeOptions): org.openqa.selenium.SessionNotCreatedException: Could not start a new session. Response code 500. Message: session not created: This version of ChromeDriver only supports Chrome version 110


Also the code check fails on the java side thing is my PR did not do any java changes, so the failing test must have been caused by an earlier commit!

The analyze Java is throwing internally following error:

Error: 4-20 18:11:56] [autobuild] [ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project myfaces-quarkus: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.apache.myfaces.core.extensions.quarkus:myfaces-quarkus:jar:4.0.1-SNAPSHOT: Could not transfer artifact io.quarkus.http:quarkus-http-servlet:jar:5.0.1.Final from/to central (https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2): transfer failed for https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/io/quarkus/http/quarkus-http-servlet/5.0.1.Final/quarkus-http-servlet-5.0.1.Final.jar: Connect to repo.maven.apache.org:443 [repo.maven.apache.org/146.75.28.215] failed: Connection timed out (Connection timed out) -> [Help 1]

@melloware guess this is your part, right?

I will merge nevertheless, the build problems have nothing to do with my code.
The built atm simply is broken! No need to hold off with my PR since the relevant tests pass on it!

Please change the version directly in [.github/workflows/myfaces-ci.yml](https://github.com/apache/myfaces/tree/main/.github/workflows/myfaces-ci.yml) you can specify the chromeDriverVersion in the mvn cmd line

Hi, I can have a look at it in the afternoon, I am project bound until then.
Otherwise someone else can go ahead!

But thanks for the hint!

We should revisit this part anyway, I have added in the TCK tests a third party library wich takes care details of the driver pulling and
finding the correct version to a major degree.
This might come in handy here as well!

The naming container fixes? I will check it tomorrow, but that might take a while (maybe next week) to get it fixed. I have a bigger issue with multi forms still pending, and my time is limited, given that I have been reassigned to a project. I will see what I can do! As for the 4606, I need to check the 2.2 branch, I will do that tomorrow together with the pending 4.0 fix!
Closing in favor of Werner's PRs - #583
Sorry, I only meant 4606 to 2.2 ( didn't see the updates in the JIRA).
Perfect, will fix it later today, already have it fixed, but I need to find time to run my usual tests!
is 3.0 expected any time soon?

Hmm. I see that the coordinate moved, so the latest is 3.2: 

org.apache.commons/commons-digester3

Let me look at this more.   

Edit: 
I don't see any updates in the past 10 years.  

3.0 says there are breaking API changes: https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-digester/commons-digester-3.0/RELEASE-NOTES.txt 

I think 2.1 is okay to use and it's still  a stable release.  Doesn't matter to much here since 2.3-next / 4.0 moved away from the digester libraries anyway.

2.3.x commit: https://github.com/apache/myfaces/commit/cd67dbe485e39968714f7893ee5817b9cd8bd8ca

2.2.x commit: https://github.com/apache/myfaces/commit/f7cdd7850c3aa232ed87cacfdf03d8d30139dd3f
Thank you!
I have to make one more fix.

Is remove even supported by Specs?
AFAIR we return a unmodifiable list

On the Iterator versions of getMessages I believe it is but on the List implementions of the return you are right its an unmodifiable List.    How can we ask?  Should I open a question on the Faces API GitHub?
Try to check the javadocs and specs

As far as I can see section 6.1.6 Message Queue deals with messages but it just mentions returning Iterators but not whether messages can be removed from the iterator at any phase?

**6.1.6. Message Queue**

`public void addMessage(String clientId, FacesMessage message);`

During the Apply Request Values, Process Validations, Update Model Values, and Invoke Application
phases of the request processing lifecycle, messages can be queued to either the component tree as
a whole (if clientId is null), or related to a specific component based on its client identifier.

```java
public Interator<String> getClientIdsWithMessages();
public Severity getMaximumSeverity();
public Iterator<FacesMessage> getMessages(String clientId);
public Iterator<FacesMessage> getMessages();
```
The `getClientIdsWithMessages()` method must return an Iterator over the client identifiers for which
at least one Message has been queued. This method must be implemented so the clientIds are
returned in the order of calls to `addMessage()`. The `getMaximumSeverity()` method returns the
highest severity level on any Message that has been queued, regardless of whether or not the
message is associated with a specific client identifier or not. The `getMessages(String)` method
returns an Iterator over queued Messages, either those associated with the specified client
identifier, or those associated with no client identifier if the parameter is null. The `getMessages()`
method returns an Iterator over all queued Messages, whether or not they are associated with a
particular client identifier. Both of the `getMessage()` variants must be implemented such that the
messages are returned in the order in which they were added via calls to `addMessage()`.

if this PR fixes the .remove case -> +1
i would only apply it for trunk for now TBH
OK I fixed it now and updated the PR to handle the scenario of removal and using 1 collection to iterate.
@werpu please review this i think its OK but wanted to check with you?

Also these tests are failing and want to make sure they are correctly failing before I fix them?

can you please check if those are really invalid tests now?

maybe we have to think about a config, to disable those checks for easier migration; not sure
why is it not correct use FC? not available yet?

i general i think its a nice feature but MyfacesConfig is currently handled AppScoped, to correctly support it, we would need to be request scoped (EL can change each request)
i would close it as wont fix for now TBH
I will look at the tests.  It was just an awful lot of failures that I was not expecting but let me investigate.
OK closing as wont fix!
OK I have it down to 1 failing test I am trying to figure out why it is failing.  I had to remove some tests that were completely invalid based on these new rules.
OK all tests updated and passing.   I still don't understand how I can update the taglib.xml to add the text descriptions for these attributes?
do we even have a taglib?

I'm not able to recreate a simple test here, but the fix looks right as far I can tell. I will also preform TCK testing later on to verify no regressions occur.
As for removing the Annotation Provider, does the quarkus extension need it? I see there's a QuarkusAnnotationProvider.

then we should move the CDI logic to DefaultAnnotationProvider and remove the old stuff

I think I'd rather just add the new field rather than make a whole new class. Current UIIterate work will be saved on the `spec1263-uiiterate` branch. I'll update this just to add rowStatePreserved to UIRepeat

Updated the PR, but I reused many methods from UIData. This shows the necessity to create a super class to share all the overlapping methods, perhaps it can be accomplished in 5.0. 

All that is left to add a junit test and pass the TCK.

+1
we need a base class in 5.0
I will leave this pull request open for a few days and merge on monday!
Running tests. Will report later. Thanks for getting this PR up!
Merging so that I can create 4.0.2 jars to test the TCK with.
does it fix the issue for you?

Haven't run the the full tck yet, but the one test that failed is now passing. I should have all the results by tomorrow. I think the changes should be fine. 

Can you get a PR for the older JS code base and I can port it all the other affected branches? Thanks!
i would like to have some tests before merging such a change

Tried to create a simple scenario, but so far no luck.  This DupId Exception is also difficult to replicate easily. 

 I'm not familiar with p:calendar but my suspicion is that the tree under it is creating elements which aren't marked. Thus during the restore phase, the children are simply added.  Specifically, it relates to the component resources created by p:calendar.  (target is ComponentResourceContainer and the child is jakarta.faces.component.UIOutput.  ) 
 
 This getChildList.add causes the duplicate id exception since restored child elements match an id of an existing element.  I believe the faulty element is `inputmask/inputmask.js.xhtml?ln=primefaces&v=13.0.0"`? 
 
 See error from the original test app: 
 
 ```
 org.apache.myfaces.view.facelets.compiler.DuplicateIdException: Component with duplicate id "j_id__rd_5" found. The first component is {Component-Path : [Class: jakarta.faces.component.UIViewRoot,ViewId: /test.xhtml][Class: org.apache.myfaces.component.ComponentResourceContainer,Id: jakarta_faces_location_head][Class: jakarta.faces.component.UIOutput,Id: j_id__rd_5]}
```
